definitions.definition: a statue, stone, etc. that is built in order to remind people of an important past event or of a famous person who has died

examples.text: a **war memorial** *(= in memory of soldiers who died in a war)*
a memorial to victims of the Holocaust
The memorial stands on the village green.
The president today unveiled a memorial to those who died in the disaster.
a makeshift memorial marked by posters and flowers
This ruin became a memorial for the victims of the bombing.

definitions.definition: a thing that will continue to remind people of somebody/something

examples.text: The painting will be a lasting memorial to a remarkable woman.

definitions.definition: a ceremony that is held to remember somebody who has died or an important past event

examples.text: a memorial for victims of the air crash
They are holding a memorial for it.

wordOrigin: late Middle English: from late Latin memoriale ‘record, memory, monument’, from Latin memorialis ‘serving as a reminder’, from memoria ‘memory’.
